snippet: The visit to Seoul by President Xi Jinping of China appears to be aimed at disrupting the alliances the United States has developed in the region.
abstract: President Xi Jinping of China arrives in South Korea for a state visit to a vital American ally in move that appears to signal his resolve to unsettle America’s alliances in Northeast Asia; in the past, Chinese leaders have visited their ally North Korea before visiting South Korea, but Xi appears eager to strengthen some alliances and let others simmer.

byline.contributor: Choe Sang-hun contributed reporting from Seoul, and Bree Feng from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The visit to Seoul by President Xi Jinping of China appears to be aimed at disrupting the alliances the United States has developed in the region.

headline.main: Chinese President’s Visit to South Korea Is Seen as Way to Weaken U.S. Alliances
headline.print_headline: Chinese President’s Visit to South Korea Is Seen as Way to Weaken U.S. Alliances
